text: "Look out! Here comes Dulnop" [Footnote: It made no difference whatever
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: as to what language was used. The telepathic process employed enabled
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the investigators to know all that their agents' subconscious minds took
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: in. The brains of the four automatically translated these thought-images
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: into their own language. However, this method did not enable them to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: learn what their agents were thinking, but only what they said, heard,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: and saw.] cried Kinney's agent; at the same time she made a special
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: effort, and succeeded in breaking off a good half of the branch.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Instantly she darted to one side, where she calmly began to pluck some
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: small, hard-shelled nuts from the branch, and proceeded to crack them,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: with entire ease, using a set of teeth which must have been absolutely
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: perfect.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: She gave the latest comer only a glance or two. He--for it certainly was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: a man--was nearly a half a foot taller than the girl already described;
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: but he was plainly not much older or younger, and in build and color
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: much the same. He was clothed neither more nor less than she, the only
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: difference being that some leopard-like animal had contributed the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: material. In his belt was tucked a primitive stone hammer, also a stone
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: knife. His face was longer than hers, his eyes darker; but he was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: manifestly still very boyish. Dulnop, they had called him.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Hail, Cunora!" he called to the girl who had brought the nuts; then, to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: her who was watching: "Rolla! Where got ye the nuts?"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla didn't answer; she couldn't use her mouth just then; it was too
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: full of nuts. She merely nodded in the direction of Cunora.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Give me some, Cunora!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The younger girl gave no reply, but backed away from him as he
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: approached; her eyes sparkled mischievously and the doctor thought,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: somewhat affectionately. Dulnop made a sudden darting move toward her
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: branch, and she as swiftly whirled in her tracks, so that he missed.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: However, he instantly changed his mind and grasped the girl instead.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Like a flash he drew her to him and kissed her noisily.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Next second he was staggering backward under the weight of her hard
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: brown fist. "Do that again, and I'll have the hair out of thy head!" the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: girl screamed, her face flaming. Yet Kinney saw that the man was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: laughing joyously even as he rubbed the spot where her blow had landed,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: while the expression of her eyes quite belied what she had said.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Not until then did the doctor's agent say anything. When she spoke it
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was in a deep, contralto voice which gave the impression of riper years
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: than either of the other two. Afterward Kinney learned that Rolla was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: nearly ten years their senior, a somewhat more lithe specimen of the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: same type, clad in the skin of what was once a magnificent goat. She
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: carried only a single small knife in her belt. As seen reflected in
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: pools of water, her complexion was slightly paler and her whole
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: expression a little less self-assertive and distinctively philosophical.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: To those who admire serious, thoughtful women of regular feature and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: different manner, Rolla would have seemed downright beautiful.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Dulnop," said she, with a laugh in her voice, "ye will do well to seek
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the nut tree, first as last." She nonchalantly crushed another shell in
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: her mouth. "Neither Cunora nor I can spare good food to a kiss-hungry
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: lout like thee!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: He only laughed again and made as though to come toward her. She stood
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: ready to dodge, chuckling excitedly, and he evidently gave it up as a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: bad job. "Tell me whence cameth the nuts, Cunora!" he begged; but the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: girl pretended to be cross, and shut her mouth as firmly as its contents
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: would allow.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Next moment there was a shout from the thicket, together with a crashing
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: sound; and shortly the fourth Sanusian appeared. He was by far the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: larger; but his size was a matter of width rather than of height. An
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: artist would have picked him as a model for Ajax himself. His muscles
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: fairly strained the huge lion's skin in which he was clad, and he had
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: twice the weight of Dulnop within the same height. Also, to the doctor's
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: eye, he was nearer Rolla's age.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: His face was strong and handsome in a somewhat fierce, relentless way;
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: his complexion darker than the rest. He carried a huge club, such as
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: must have weighed all of forty pounds, while his belt was jammed full of
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: stone weapons. The doctor classed him and the younger girl together
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: because of their vigor and independence, while Dulnop and Rolla seemed
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: to have dispositions very similar in their comparative gentleness and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: restraint.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Hail, all of ye!" shouted this latest arrival in a booming baritone. He
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: strode forward with scarcely a glance at the two younger people; his
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: gaze was fixed upon Rolla, his expression unmistakable. The woman
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: quietly turned upon Dulnop and Cunora.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Look!" she exclaimed, pointing to a spot back of them. "See the curious
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: bird!" They wheeled instantly, with the unquestioning faith of two
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: children; and before they had brought their gazes back again, the big
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: man had seized Rolla, crushed her to his breast and kissed her
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: passionately. She responded just as warmly, pushing him away only in
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: order to avoid being seen by the others. They showed only an innocent
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: disappointment at having missed seeing the "curious bird."
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "A simple-minded people, basically good-humored," was the way the doctor
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: summed the matter up when reporting what he had seen. However, it was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: not so easy to analyze certain things that were said during the time the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: four Sanusians spent in each other's company. For one thing--
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Did They give thee permission to go?" Rolla was asked by the big man.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: His name, it seemed, was Corrus.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Yes, Corrus. They seemed to think it a good idea for us to take a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: little recreation to-day. I suppose ye left thy herd with thy brother?"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: He nodded; and the doctor was left to wonder whom "They" might be. Were
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: They a small group of humans, whose function was to superintend? Or were
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: They, as the books from Venus seemed to indicate, another type of
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: creature, entirely different from the humans, and yet, because of the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: peculiar Sanusian conditions, superior to the humans?
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "They have decided to move their city a little farther away from the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: forest," Rolla overheard Dulnop telling Cunora; which was the first
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: indication that the planet boasted such a thing as a city. Otherwise,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: things appeared to be in a primitive, rather than a civilized condition.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: These four skin-clad savages seemed to be enjoying an aboriginal picnic.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: For lunch, they munched on various fruits and nuts picked up en route,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: together with handfuls of some wheat-like cereal which the big man had
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: brought in a goatskin. From time to time they scared out various animals
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: from the brush, chasing the creatures after the fashion of dogs and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: children. Whenever they came to a stream, invariably all four splashed
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: through it, shouting and laughing with delight.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: However, there were but two of these streams, and both of them quite
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: small. Their banks indicated that either the season was very far
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: advanced, or else that the streams were at one time vastly larger.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "A rather significant fact," the doctor afterward commented.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Nevertheless, the most impressive thing about all that the doctor
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: learned that day was the strange manner in which the excursion came to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: an end. The quartet was at that moment climbing a small hill, apparently
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: on the edge of an extensive range of mountains. An occasional tree,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: something like an oak, broke the monotony of the brush at this point,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: and yet it was not until Rolla was quite at the top of the knoll that
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Kinney could see surrounding country with any degree of clearness. Even
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: then he learned little.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The hill was placed on one edge of a valley about forty miles in width.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: A good part of it was covered with dusty vegetation, presumably wild;
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: but the rest was plainly under cultivation. There were large green
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: areas, such as argued grain fields; elsewhere were what looked like
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: orchards and vineyards, some of which were in full bloom--refuting the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: notion that the season was a late one. Nowhere was there a spot of land
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: which might be called barren.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla and her three friends stood taking this in, keeping a rather
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: curious silence meanwhile. At length Cunora gave a deep sigh, which was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: almost instantly reproduced by all the rest. Corrus followed his own
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: sigh with a frank curse.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "By the great god Mownoth!" he swore fiercely. "It be a shame that we
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: cannot come hence a great deal oftener! Methinks They could allow it!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "They care not for our longings," spoke Cunora, her eyes flashing as
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: angrily as his. "They give us enough freedom to make us work the better
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: --no more! All They care for is thy herd and my crops!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "And for the labor," reminded the big man, "of such brains as Rolla's
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: and Dulnop's. It be not right that They should drive us so!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Aye," agreed the younger man, with much less enthusiasm. "However, what
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: can ye do about it, Corrus?"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The big man's face flushed, and he all but snarled. "I tell ye what I
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: can do! I, and ye as well, if ye but will! I can--"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: He stopped, one hand upraised in mighty emphasis, and a sudden and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: startling change came over him. Downright fear drove the anger from his
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: face; his massive body suddenly relaxed, and all his power and vigor
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: seemed to crumble and wilt. His hands shook; his mouth trembled. At the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: same time the two women shrank from him, each giving an inarticulate cry
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: of alarm and distress. Dulnop gave no sound, but the anger which had
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: left the herdsman seemed to have come to him; the youngster's eyes
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: flared and his breast heaved. His gaze was fixed upon Corrus's neck,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: where the sweat of fear already glistened.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Suddenly the big man dropped his head, as though in surrender. He gasped
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: and found voice; this time a voice as shaky and docile as it had been
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: strong and dominant a moment before.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Very well," he spoke abjectly. "Very well. I--shall do as you wish." He
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: seemed to be talking to thin air. "We--will go home at once."
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: And instantly all four turned about, and in perfect silence took the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: back trail.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: III
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: WORLD OF MAMMOTHS
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Immediately upon going into tele-consciousness Smith became aware of a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: decided change in his surroundings. The interior of the study had been
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: darkened with drawn shades; now he was using eyes that were exposed to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the most intense sunlight. The first sight that he got, in fact, was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: directed toward the sky; and he noted with an engineer's keen interest
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: that the color of the sky was blue, slightly tinged with orange. This,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: he knew, meant that the atmosphere of Sanus contained at least one
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: chemical element which is lacking on the earth.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: For a minute or two the sky remained entirely clear. There were no
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: clouds whatever; neither did any form of winged life make its
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: appearance. So Smith took note of sounds.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Presumably his agent--whoever or whatever it might be--was located in
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: some sort of aircraft; for an extremely loud and steady buzzing,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: suggesting a powerful engine, filled the engineer's borrowed ears. Try
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: as he might, however, he could not identify the sound exactly. It was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: more like an engine than anything else, except that the separate sounds
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: which comprised the buzz occurred infinitely close together. Smith
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: concluded that the machine was some highly developed rotary affair,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: working at perhaps six or eight thousand revolutions a minute--three or
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: four times as fast as an ordinary engine.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Meanwhile his agent continued to stare into the sky. Shortly something
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: arrived in the field of vision; a blurred speck, far to one side. It
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: approached leisurely, with the unknown agent watching steadfastly. It
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: still remained blurred, however; for a long time the engineer knew as
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: little about its actual form as he knew about his mysterious agent.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Then, like a flash, the vision cleared. All the blurring disappeared
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: instantly, and the form of a buzzard was disclosed. It was almost
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: directly overhead, about a quarter of a mile distant, and soaring in a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: wide spiral. No sound whatever came from it. Smith's agent made no move
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: of any kind, but continued to watch.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Shortly the buzzard "banked" for a sharper turn; and the engineer saw,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: by the perspective of its apparent speed, that the aircraft whose use he
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was enjoying was likewise on the move. Apparently it was flying in a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: straight line, keeping the sun--an object vastly too brilliant to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: examine--on the right.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The buzzard went out of sight. Once more the clear sky was all that
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: could be seen; that, and the continual roar of the engine, were all that
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Smith actually knew. He became impatient for his agent to look
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: elsewhere; it might be that the craft contained other specimens of the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: unknown creatures. But there was no change in the vigilant watch which
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was being kept upon the sky.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Suddenly the engineer became exceedingly alert. He had noticed something
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: new--something so highly different from anything he had expected to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: learn that it was some minutes before he could believe it true.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: His borrowed eyes had no eyelids! At least, if they did, they were never
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: used. Not once did they flicker in the slightest; not once did they
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: blink or wink, much less close themselves for a momentary rest from the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: sun's glare. They remained as stonily staring as the eyes of a marble
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: statue.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Then something startling happened. With the most sickening suddenness
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the aircraft came to an abrupt halt. Smith's senses swam with the jolt
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: of it. All about him was a confused jumble of blurred figures and forms;
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: it was infinitely worse than his first ride in a hoist. In a moment,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: however, he was able to examine things fairly well.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The aircraft had come to a stop in the middle of what looked like a cane
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: brake. On all sides rose yellowish-green shafts, bearing leaves
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: characteristic of the maize family. Smith knew little about cane, yet
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: felt sure that these specimens were a trifle large. "Possibly due to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: difference in gravitation," he thought.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: However, he could not tell much about the spot on which the machine had
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: landed. For a moment it was motionless; the engine had been stopped, and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: all was silent except for the gentle rustling of the cane in the field.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The unknown operator did not change his position in the slightest. Then
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the craft began to move over the surface, in a jerky lurching fashion
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: which indicated a very rough piece of ground. At the same time a queer,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: leathery squeaking came to the engineer's borrowed ears; he concluded
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: that the machine was being sorely strained by the motion. At the time he
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was puzzled to account for the motion itself. Either there was another
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: occupant of the craft, who had climbed out and was now pushing the thing
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: along the ground, or else some form of silent mechanism was operating
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the wheels upon which, presumably, the craft was mounted. Shortly the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: motion stopped altogether.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: It was then that Smith noticed something he had so far ignored because
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: he knew his own dinner hour was approaching. His agent was hungry, like
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: himself. He noticed it because, just then, he received a very definite
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: impression of the opposite feeling; the agent was eating lunch of some
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: sort, and enjoying it. There was no doubt about this. All that Smith
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: could do was to wish, for the hundredth time, that he could look around
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: a little and see what was being eaten, and how.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The meal occupied several minutes. Not once did the strange occupant of
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: that machine relax his stony stare at the sky, and Smith tried to forget
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: how hungry he was by estimating the extent of his vision. He decided
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: that the angle subtended about a hundred and sixty degrees, or almost
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: half a circle; and he further concluded that if his agent possessed a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: nose, it was a pretty trifling affair, too small to be noticed. It was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: obvious, too, that the fellow's mouth was located much lower in the face
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: than normal. He ate without showing a single particle of food, and did
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: it very quietly.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: At length hunger was satisfied. There was complete stillness and silence
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: for a moment, then another short lurching journey through the cane; and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: next, with an abruptness that made the engineer's senses swim again, the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: fellow once more took to the air. The speed with which he "got away" was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: enough to make a motorcyclist, doing his best, seem to stand still.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: It took time for Smith to regain his balance. When he did, the same
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: unbroken expanse of sky once more met his gaze; but it was not long
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: until, out of the corners of those unblinking eyes, he could make out
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: bleary forms which shortly resolved themselves into mountain tops. It
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was odd, the way things suddenly flashed into full view. One second they
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: would be blurred and unrecognizable; the next, sharply outlined and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: distinct as anything the engineer had ever seen. Yet, there seemed to be
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: no change in the focus of those eyes. It wasn't as though they were
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: telescopic, either. Not until long afterward did Smith understand the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: meaning of this.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The mountains grew higher and nearer. Before long it seemed as though
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the aircraft was entering some sort of a canon. Its sides were only
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: sparsely covered with vegetation, and all of it was quite brown, as
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: though the season were autumn. For the most part the surface was of
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: broken rock and boulders.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Within a space of three or four minutes the engineer counted not less
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: than ten buzzards. The unknown operator of the machine, however, paid no
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: attention to them, but continued his extraordinary watch of the heavens.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Smith began to wonder if the chap were not seated in an air-tight,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: sound-proof chamber, deep in the hull of some great aerial cruiser, with
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: his eyes glued fast to a periscope. "Maybe a sky patrol," thought the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: man of the earth; "a cop on the lookout for aerial smugglers, like as
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: not."
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: And then came another of those terrifying stops. This time, as soon as
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: he could collect his senses, the engineer saw that the machine had
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: landed approximately in the middle of the canon, and presumably among
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the boulders in its bottom. For all about it were the tops of gigantic
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: rocks, most of them worn smooth from water action. And, as soon as the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: engine stopped, Smith plainly heard the roar of water right at hand. He
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: could not see it, however. Why in the name of wonder didn't the fellow
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: look down, for a change?
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The craft began to move. This time its motion was smoother arguing an
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: even surface. However, it had not gone far before, to the engineer's
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: astonishment, it began to move straight down a slope so steep that no
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: mechanism with which Smith was familiar could possibly have clung to it.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: As this happened, his adopted eyes told him that the craft was located
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: upon one of those enormous boulders, in the center of a stream of such
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: absolute immensity that he fairly gasped. The thing was--colossal!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: And yet it was true. The unseen machine deliberately moved along until
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: it was actually clinging, not to the top, but to the side of the rock.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The water appeared to be about five yards beneath, to the right. To the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: left was the sky, while the center of that strange vision was now upon a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: similar boulder seemingly a quarter of a mile distant, farther out in
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the stream. But the fellow at the periscope didn't change position one
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: whit!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: It was so unreal. Smith deliberately ignored everything else and watched
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: again for indications of eyelids. He saw not one flicker, but noticed a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: certain tiny come-and-go, the merest sort of vibration, which indicated
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the agent's heart-action. Apparently it beat more than twice as fast as
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Smith's.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: But it relieved him to know that his agent was at least a genuine living
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: being. For a moment he had fancied something utterly repellent to him.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Suppose this Sanusian were not any form of natural creature at all, but
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: some sort of supermachine, capable of functioning like an organism? The
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: thought made the engineer shudder as no morgue could.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Presently the queer craft approached the water closely enough, and at
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: such an angle, that Smith looked eagerly for a reflection. However, the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: water was exceedingly rough, and only a confused brownish blur could be
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: made out. Once he caught a queer sound above the noise of the water; a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: shrill hiss, with a harsh whine at the end. "Just like some kind of
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: suction apparatus," as he later described it.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: And then, with that peculiar sound fresh in his ears, came the crowning
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: shock of the whole experience. Floating toward the boulder, but some
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: distance away, was what looked like a black seed. Next moment the vision
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: flashed clear, as usual, and the engineer saw that the object was really
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: a beetle; and in a second it was so near that Smith's own body, back on
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the earth, involuntarily shrank back into the recesses of his chair.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: For that beetle was an enormity in the most unlimited sense of the word.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: It was infinitely larger than any beetle the engineer had ever seen--
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: infinitely! It was as large as a good-sized horse!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: But before Smith could get over his amazement there was a rush and a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: swirl in the water behind the insect. Spray was dashed over the rock, a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: huge form showed itself indistinctly beneath the waves, and next instant
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the borrowed eyes were showing the engineer, so clearly as to be
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: undeniable, the most astounding sight he had ever seen.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: A fish of mountainous size leaped from the water, snapped the beetle
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: into its mouth, and disappeared from sight. In a flash it had come and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: gone, leaving the engineer fairly gasping and likewise wondering how he
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: could possibly expect anybody to believe him if he told the bald truth
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: of what he had seen.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: For he simply could not have invented anything half as incredible. The
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: fish simply could not be described with ordinary language. IT WAS AS
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: LARGE AS THE LARGEST LOCOMOTIVE.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: IV
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: THE GOLD-MINER
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: As for Van Emmon, his experience will have to be classed with Smith's.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: That is to say, he soon came to feel that his agent was not what is
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: commonly called human. It was all too different. However, he found
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: himself enjoying a field of view which was a decided improvement upon
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Smith's. Instead of a range which began and ended just above the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: horizon, his agent possessed the power of looking almost straight ahead.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: This told the geologist that his unsuspecting Sanusian was located in an
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: aircraft much like the other. The same tremendous noise of the engine,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the same inexplicable wing action, together with the same total lack of
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the usual indications of human occupancy, all argued that the two men
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: had hit upon the same type of agent. In Van Emmon's case, however, he
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: could occasionally glimpse two loose parts of the machine, flapping and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: swaying oddly from time to time within the range of the observer, and at
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the front. Nothing was done about it. Van Emmon came to the same
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: conclusion as Smith; the operator was looking into something like a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: periscope. Perhaps he himself did not do the driving.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: From what the geologist could see of the country below, it was quite
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: certainly cultivated. In no other way could the even rows and uniform
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: growth be explained; even though Van Emmon could not say whether the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: vegetation were tree, shrub, or plant, it was certainly the work of man
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: --or something mightily like man.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Shortly he experienced an abrupt downward dive, such as upset his senses
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: somewhat. When he recovered, he had time for only the swiftest glance at
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: what, he thought rather vaguely, was a great green-clad mountain. Then
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: his agent brought the craft to one of those nerve-racking stops; once
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: more came a swimming of the brain, and then the geologist saw something
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: that challenged his understanding.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The craft had landed on the rim of a deep pit, or what would have been
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: called a pit if it had not been so extraordinary. Mainly the strangeness
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was a matter of color; the slope was of a brilliant orange, and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: seemingly covered with frost, for it sparkled so brightly in the sun as
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: to actually hurt the eyes. In fact, the geologist's first thought was "A
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: glacier," although he could not conceive of ice or snow of that tint.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Running down the sides of the pit were a number of dark-brown streaks,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: about a yard wide; Van Emmon could make them out, more or less clearly,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: on the other side of the pit as well. From the irregular way in which
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the walls were formed, he quickly decided that the pit was a natural
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: one. The streaks, he thought, might have been due to lava flow.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: His agent proceeded to drive straight over the rim and down the slope
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: into the pit. His engine was quite stopped; like Smith, the geologist
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: wondered just how the craft's wheels were operated. Next he was holding
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: his breath as the machine reached so steep a point in the slope that,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: most surely, no brakes could hold it. Simultaneously he heard the hiss
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: and whine which seemed to indicate the suction device.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "It was a whole lot like going down into a placer mine," the geologist
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: afterward said; and in view of what next met his eyes, he was justified
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: in his guess.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Down crept the machine until it was "standing on its nose." The sun was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: shining almost straight down into the slope, and Van Emmon forgot his
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: uneasiness about the craft in his interest in what he saw.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The bottom of the pit was perhaps twenty feet in diameter, and roughly
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: hemispherical. Standing up from its bottom were half a dozen slim
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: formations, like idealized stalagmites; they were made of some
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: semitransparent rock, apparently, the tint being a reddish yellow.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Finally, perched on the top of each of these was a stone; and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: surrounding these six "landmarks," as Van Emmon called them, was the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: most prodigious display of wealth imaginable.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: For the whole queer place was simply sprinkled with gold. Gold--gold
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: everywhere; large nuggets of it, as big as one's fist! Not embedded in
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: rock, not scattered through sand, but lying LOOSE upon the surface of
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: that unbelievable orange snow! It was overwhelming.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The mysterious Sanusian lost no time. Operating some unseen machinery,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: he caused three shovel-like devices to project from the front of his
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: machine; and these instantly proceeded, so swiftly that Van Emmon could
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: not possibly watch their action, to pick up nuggets and stow them away
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: out of sight in what must have been compartments in the hull. All this
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was done without any sound beyond the occasional thud of a nugget
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: dropped in the scramble.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Suddenly the Sanusian wheeled his machine about and started hurriedly up
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the slope. Van Emmon judged that the chap had been frightened by
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: something, for he took flight as soon as he reached the top of the pit.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: And--he left half a million in gold behind him!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: This new flight had not lasted two minutes before the geologist began to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: note other objects in the air. There were birds, so distant that he
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: could not identify them; one came near enough, however, for him to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: conclude that it was a hawk. But he did not hold to this conclusion very
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: long.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The thing that changed his mind was another aircraft. It approached from
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: behind, making even more noise than the other, and proceeded to draw
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: abreast of it. From time to time Van Emmon's agent turned his mysterious
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: periscope so as to take it all in, and the geologist was able to watch
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: his fill. Whereupon he became converted to a new idea:
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The birds that Smith and he had seen had not been birds at all, but
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: aircraft built in imitation of them.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: For this new arrival had been made in almost perfect imitation of a bee!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: It was very close to an exact reproduction. For one exception, it did
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: not have the hairy appearance so characteristic of bees; the body and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "legs" were smooth, and shiny. (Later, Van Emmon saw machines which went
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: so far as even to imitate the hairs.) Also, instead of trying to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: duplicate the two compound eyes which are found, one on each side of a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: bee's head, a perfectly round representation of a single eye was built,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: like a conning tower, toward the front of the bow. Presumably, the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: observer sat or stood within this "head."
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: But otherwise it was wonderfully like a drone bee. Van Emmon was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: strongly reminded of what he had once viewed under a powerful lens. The
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: fragile semitransparent wings, the misshapen legs, and even the jointed
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: body with its scale-like segments, all were carefully duplicated on a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: large scale. Imagine a bee thirty feet long!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: At first the geologist was puzzled to find that it carried a pair of
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: many-jointed antennae. He could not see how any intelligent being would
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: make use of them; they were continually waving about, much as bees wave
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: theirs. Evidently these were the loose objects he had already noted.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Now," he wondered, "why in thunder did the builders go to so much
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: trouble for the sake of mere realism?"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Then he saw that the antennae served a very real purpose. There was no
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: doubt about it; they were wireless antennae!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: For presently the newcomer, who so far had not shown himself at any
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: point on his machine, sent out a message which was read as quickly as it
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was received by Van Emmon's agent, and as unconsciously translated:
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Number Eight Hundred Four, you are wanted on Plot Seventeen."
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Whereupon Van Emmon's unknown assistant replied at once:
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Very well, Superior."
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: It was done by means of an extremely faint humming device, reminding the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: geologist of certain wireless apparata he had heard. Not a word was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: actually spoken by either Sanusian.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Van Emmon kept a close watch upon the conning tower on the other
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: machine. The sun was shining upon it in such a fashion that its gleam

title: The Emancipatrix

title: The Emancipatrix

title: The Emancipatrix

title: The Emancipatrix

title: The Emancipatrix
