text: villagers, many of them, tried time after time to escape from bondage?
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: And had they not inevitably been apprehended and driven back, to be
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: tortured as an example to the rest? It would never do to be caught!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: So they made it a practice to travel only during twilight and dawn,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: remaining hidden through the day. Invariably one stood watch while the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: other slept. The bees were--everywhere!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Upon crossing the range of mountains going down the other side, Cunora
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: and Rolla began to feel hopeful of two things--first, that their luck
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: would change, and the wonderful stone be found; and second, that they
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: would be in no danger from the bees in this new country, which seemed to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: be a valley much like the one they had quit. It was all quite new and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: strange to them, and in their interest they almost forgot at times that
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: each had a terrible score to settle when her chance finally came.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Twice they had exceedingly narrow escapes. Always they kept carefully
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: hid, but on the third day Cunora, advancing cautiously through some
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: brush, came suddenly upon two bees feeding. She stopped short and held
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: her breath. Neither saw her, so intent were they upon their honey; yet
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora felt certain that each had been warned to watch out for her. This
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was true; Billie learned that every bee on the planet had been told. And
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: so Cunora silently backed away, an inch at a time, until it was safe to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: turn and run.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: On another occasion Rolla surprised a big drone bee, just as she bent to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: take a drink of water from a stream. The insect had been out of her
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: sight, on the other side of a boulder. It rose with an angry buzz as she
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: bent down; a few feet away from her it hung in the air, apparently
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: scrutinizing her to make sure that she was one of the runaways. Her
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: heart leaped to her mouth. Suppose they were reported!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: She made a lightninglike grab at the thing, and very nearly caught it.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Straight up it shot, taken by surprise, and dashed blindly into a ledge
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: of rock which hung overhead. For a second it floundered, dazed; and that
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: second was its last. Cunora gave a single bound forward, and with a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: vicious swing of a palm-leaf, which she always carried, smashed the bee
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: flat.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Before they had been free five days they came to an exceedingly serious
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: conclusion: that it was only a question of time until they were caught.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Sooner or later they must be forced to return; they could not hope to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: dodge bees much longer. When Rolla fully realized this she turned
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: gravely to the younger girl.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Methinks the time has come for us to make a choice, Cunora. Which shall
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: it be: live as we have been living for the past four days, with the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: certainty of being caught in time or--face the unknown perils on the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: edge of the world?"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora dropped the piece of stone she had been inspecting and shivered
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: with fear. "A dreadful choice ye offer, Rolla! Think of the horrible
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: beasts we must encounter!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Ye mean," corrected the philosophical one--"ye mean, the beasts which
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: men SAY they have seen. Tell me; hast ever seen such thyself? Many times
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: hast thou been near the edge, I know."
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The girl shook her head. "Nay; not I. Yet these beasts must be, Rolla;
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: else why should all men tell of them?"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "I note," remarked Rolla thoughtfully, "that each man tells of seeing a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: different sort of beast. Perchance they were all but lies."
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: However, it was Cunora's fear of capture, rather than her faith in
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla's reasoning, which drove the girl to the north. For to the north
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: they traveled, a matter of some two weeks; and not once did they dare
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: relax their vigilance. Wherever they went, there was vegetation of some
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: sort, and wherever there was vegetation bees were likely to be found. By
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the time the two weeks were over, the women were in a state of near-
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: hysteria, from the nervous strain of it all. Moreover, both suffered
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: keenly for want of cereals, to which they were accustomed; they were
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: heartily tired of such fruits and nuts as they were able to pick up
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: without exposing themselves.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: One morning before daybreak they came to the upper end of a long, narrow
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: valley--one which paralleled their own, by the way--and as they emerged
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: from the plain into the foot-hills it was clear that they had reached a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: new type of country. There was comparatively little brush; and with
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: every step the rockiness increased. By dawn they were on the edge of a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: plateau; back of them stretched the inhabited country; ahead, a haze-
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: covered expanse. Nothing but rocks was about them.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Ye are sure that we had best keep on?" asked Cunora uneasily.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla nodded, slowly but positively. "It is best. Back of us lies
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: certain capture. Ahead--we know not what; but at least there is a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: chance!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Nevertheless, both hesitated before starting over the plateau. Each
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: gazed back longingly over the home of their kind; and for a moment
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla's resolution plainly faltered. She hesitated; Cunora made a move
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: as though to return. And at that instant their problem was decided for
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: them.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: A large drone passed within six feet of them. Both heard the buzz, and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: whirled about to see the bee darting frantically out of reach. At a safe
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: distance it paused, as though to make sure of its find, then disappeared
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: down the valley. They had been located!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "We have no choice now!" cried Rolla, speaking above a whisper for the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: first time in weeks. "On, as fast as ye can, Cunora!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The two sped over the rocks, making pretty good time considering the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: loads they carried. Each had a good-sized goatskin full of various dried
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: fruits and nuts, also a gourd not so full. In fact, it had been some
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: while since they had had fresh water. Cunora was further weighed down by
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: some six pounds of dried rabbit meat; the animals had been caught in
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: snares. Both, however, discarded their palm leaves; they would be of no
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: further use now.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: And thus they fled, knowing that they had, at most, less than a day
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: before the drone would return with enough soldiers to compel obedience.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: For the most part, the surface was rough granite, with very little sign
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: of erosion. There was almost no water; both women showed intense joy
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: when they found a tiny pool of it standing in a crevasse. They filled
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: their gourds as well as their stomachs.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: A few steps farther on, and the pair stepped out of the shallow gully in
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: which they had been walking. Immediately they were exposed to a very
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: strong and exceedingly cold wind, such as seemed to surprise them in no
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: way, but compelled both to actually lean against its force. Moreover,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: although this pressure was all from the left, it proved exceedingly
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: difficult to go on. Their legs seemed made of lead, and their breathing
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was strangely labored. This, also, appeared to be just what they had
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: expected.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Presently, however, they found another slight depression the rocks; and
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: sheltered from the wind, made a little better progress ahead. It was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: bitter cold, however; only the violence of their exercise could make
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: them warm enough to stand it. All in all, the two were considerably over
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: three hours in making the last mile; they had to stop frequently to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: rest. The only compensating thing was their freedom from worry; the bees
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: would not bother them where the wind was so strong. So long as they
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: could keep on the move they were safe.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: But what made it worse was the steadily increasing difficulty of moving
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: their legs. For, although the surface continued level, they seemed to be
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: CLIMBING now, where before they had simply walked. It was just as though
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the plateau had changed into a mountain, and they were ascending it;
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: only, upon looking back, nothing but comparatively flat rock met the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: gaze. What made them lean forward so steeply anyhow?
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla seemed to think it all very ordinary. She was more concerned about
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the wind, to which they had become once more exposed as they reached the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: end of the rift. On they pressed, five or six steps at each attempt,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: stopping to rest twice the length of time they actually traveled. It was
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: necessary now to cling to the rock with both hands, and once Cunora lost
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: her grip, so that she would have been blown to one side, or else have
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: slipped backward, had not Rolla grasped her heel and held her until she
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: could get another hand-hold.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Courage!" gasped Rolla. Perspiration was streaming down her face,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: despite the bitter cold of the wind; her hands trembled from the strain
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: she was undergoing. "Courage, Cunora! It be not much farther!" On they
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: strove. Always it seemed as though they were working upward as well as
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: onward, although the continued flatness of the surface argued
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: obstinately against this. Also, the sun remained in the same position
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: relative to the rocks; if they were climbing, it should have appeared
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: overhead. What did it mean?
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Finally Rolla saw, about a hundred yards farther on, something which
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: caused her to shout: "Almost there, Cunora!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The younger girl could not spare breath enough to reply. They struggled
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: on in silence.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Now they were down on their hands and knees. Before half the hundred
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: yards was covered, they were flat on their faces, literally clawing
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: their way upward and onward. Had the wind increased in violence in
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: proportion as the way grew harder, they could never have made it,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: physical marvels though they were. Only the absolute knowledge that they
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: dared not return drove them on; that, and the possibility of finding the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: precious stone, and of ultimately saving the two men they had left
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: behind.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The last twenty feet was the most extraordinary effort that any human
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: had ever been subjected to. They had to take turns in negotiating the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: rock; one would creep a few inches on, get a good hold, and brace
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: herself against the wind, while the other, crawling alongside, used her
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: as a sort of a crutch. Their fingers were bleeding and their finger-
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: nails cracked from the rock and cold; the same is equally true of their
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: toes. Had it been forty feet instead of twenty--
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The rocks ended there. Beyond was nothing but sky; even this was not
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: like what they were used to, but was very nearly black. Two more spurts,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: and Rolla threw one hand ahead and caught the edge of the rock. Cunora
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: dragged herself alongside. The effort brought blood to her nostrils.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: They rested a minute or two, then looked at one another in mute inquiry.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora nodded; Rolla took great breath; and they drew themselves to the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: edge and looked over.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: XII
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: OUTSIDE INFORMATION
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The two women gazed in extreme darkness. The other side of the ridge of
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: rock was black as night. From side to side the ridge extended, like a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: jagged knife edge on a prodigious scale; it seemed infinite in extent.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Behind them--that is, at their feet-lay the stone-covered expanse they
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: had just traversed; ahead of them there was--nothingness itself.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora shook with fear and cold. "Let us not go on, Rolla!" she
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: whimpered. "I like not the looks of this void; it may contain all sorts
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: of beasts. I--I am afraid!" She began to sob convulsively. Rolla peered
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: into the darkness. Nothing whatever was to be seen. It was as easy to
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: imagine enemies as friends; easier in fact. What might not the unknown
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: hold for them?
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "We cannot stay here," spoke Rolla, with what energy her condition would
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: permit. "We could not--hold on. Nor can we return now; They would surely
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: find us!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: But Cunora's courage, which had never faltered in the face of familiar
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: dangers, was not equal to the unknown. She wailed: "Rolla! A little way
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: back--a hollow in the rock! 'Tis big enough to shelter me! I would--
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: rather stay there than--go on!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Ye would rather die there, alone!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora hid her face. "Let me have half the food! I can go back to the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: pool--for water! And maybe," hopefully--"maybe They will give up the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: search in time."
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "Aye," from Rolla, bitterly. "And in time Dulnop will die, if we do
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: nothing for him--and for Corrus!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora fell to sobbing again. "I cannot help it! I am--afraid!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Rolla scarcely heard. An enormous idea had just occurred to her. She had
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: told the girl to think of Dulnop and Corrus; but was it not equally true
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: that they should think of all the other humans, their fellow slaves,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: each of whom had suffered nearly as much? Was not the fire equally
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: precious to them all?
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: She started to explain this to the girl, then abruptly gave it up. It
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was no use; Cunora's mind was not strong enough to take the step. Rolla
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: fairly gasped as she realized, as no Sanusian had realized before, that
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: she had been given the responsibility of rescuing A WHOLE RACE.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Fire she must have! And since she could not, dared not, seek it here,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: she must try the other side of the world. And she would have to do it--
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: alone!
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: "So be it!" she said loudly in a strange voice. "Ye stay here and wait,
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Cunora! I go on!"
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: And for fear her resolution would break down, she immediately crept over
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: the edge. She clung to the rock as though expecting to be dragged from
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: it. Instead, as she let her feet down into the blackness, she could feel
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: solid rock beneath her body, quite the same as she had lain upon a
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: moment before. It was like descending the opposite side of an incredibly
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: steep mountain, a mountain made of blackness itself.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: The women gave one another a last look. For all they knew, neither would
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: gaze upon the other again. Next moment, with Cunora's despairing cry
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: ringing in her ears, Rolla began to crawl backward and downward.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: She could plainly see the sun's level rays above her head, irregular
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: beams of yellowish light; it served slightly to illuminate her
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: surroundings. Shortly, however, her eyes became accustomed to the
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: darkness; the stars helped just as they had always helped; and soon she
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: was moving almost as freely as on the other side.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Once she slipped, and slid down and to one side, for perhaps ten feet.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: When she finally grabbed a sharp projecting ledge and stopped, her
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: vision almost failed from the terrible effort she had put forth. She
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: could scarcely feel the deep gash that the ledge had made in her finger-
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: tips.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: After perhaps half an hour of hard work among bare rocks exactly like
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: those she had quit, she stopped for a prolonged rest. As a matter of
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: course, she stared at the sky; and then came her first discovery.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Once more let it be understood that her view was totally different from
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: anything that has ever been seen on the earth. To be sure, "up" was over

title: The Emancipatrix

title: The Emancipatrix

text: fear of them will go ahead and make their way easy."
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: Meanwhile the nine were getting ready for their unprecedented conquest.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: They put on heavy leather clothes, also leather caps, gloves and boots.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: safety.
title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

text: little wood alcohol in a flask, in case it was necessary to burn wet or
title: The Emancipatrix

title: The Emancipatrix

title: The Emancipatrix
author: Flint, Homer Eon

title: The Emancipatrix

title: The Emancipatrix

title: The Emancipatrix

title: The Emancipatrix
